title: Looking for published examples of Swift (Unger)
content:
Stephen, did _USA Today_ really used to use Swift? I thought they always employed Gulliver.   
   
_HOW_ magazine used to use Swift, prior to the Feb 2000 redesign. I was sorry to see it go. Look for back issues for some nice Swift usage.   
   
-- K.
author: kentlew

comments.content:
There seems to be a bit of serendipitous synchronicity between this and the MyFonts forums lately. See [this post](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000041/http:/forums.myfonts.com/FontForums/read.php?f=5&i=20463&t=20463).   
   
See [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000041/http:/www.fontexplorer.com/isroot/FontStore/content/00_home/content/home_04a_finuse_f/home_04a_finuse_s.html) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000041/http:/www.gerardunger.com/news/news-soed.html) for more examples.

[MetroXpress](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000041/http:/www.clubmetro.com/) (in Denmark) uses Swift...   
If the image is _too_ large, then please feel free to erase my post (mr. Benson a.o.)   
 ![MetroXpress](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000041im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/15144.jpg)

_\>\> Kent has proved me a fool.   
\>Oh, he's done that to me too in the past._      
   
Stephen, Yves -- You guys know that's never my intent, right?   
   
_\>When push comes to shove, he proves to be the most reliable source around here._   
   
Aw shucks. No need to push or shove, though.   
   
-- K.

_\>Blame my "inventive" use of English and my silly   
Belgian sense of humour if I created some confusion   
here._      
   
Yves, no apology necessary. Your English and humor are fine.   
I wasn't being defensive, I just forgot to include the smiley. ;-)   
   
Thanks for the praise. Always glad to be of service.
